Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Maggie_Hall
Reviews.Content: Small and efficient hotel with pleasant and helpful service. Clean white towels changed daily. Close to all the major sites and on the tramway for excursions further afield. Good restaurants nearby. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location. Location. Location.”
Reviews.Author: goaway64
Reviews.Content: 1 1/2 blocks from Hagia Sophia. Hippodrome. Blue Mosque, Anthropology Museum. Covered Bazaar. Small room, good shower. Lovely Rooftop Breakfast room. Good food.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,nice comfy room”
Reviews.Author: SalimM
Reviews.Content: This is what I wrote at the time on another site: This was our second visit ot Instanbul so we were familiar with the area. WE wanted a hotel that was near to the main attractions and with good transport links (tram). The hotel nice and comfortable (a bit on the small side). It was clean and pleasant. There was a buffet breakfast which I would say was very limited but OK. The big downside for us was the building work right next door on the main road side. It seemed to start at night (may be we did not notice them during the day as we were out). and go on till early morning. The sound of the drills and cutting equipment made sleeping impossible. So check before you boook to ensure thsi building work is over. As if this was not enought, form late night the main road was being used as a racing track for motor bikes. We wre subject to contant screeching of tyres and roars of engines. This hotel is not for you if you are a light sleeper. Apart from that, could not fault the hotel. Staff were friendly as you would expect. The hotel itself was of a good standard. I wouls stay again if the building work is over - but would ask a room at the back, one away from the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but some things fell short”
Reviews.Author: FraniG00
Reviews.Content: After our 10 hour flight to Istanbul we arrived exhausted at the Pierre Loti to be told that our rooms had been given away and that they had been trying to call us but we didn't answer (because we were on the plane)! They had already made arrangements for us at another hotel for the 1 night they were unavailable and provided free transportation to the airport to compensate us for the inconvenience. The rooms were nice and the lobby, breakfast and bar areas were all very nice and had wonderful views. Many of the public areas had a strong odor of cigarettes. The staff were all very polite and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place in Istambul!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eugenia777
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in an excellent location!!! The room was comfortable and well climatizated in januaryÂ´s 2012 winter. Breakfast had a great variety, plenty of options and very good quality. The staff was very kind and helpful. The restaurant has amazing views, and, if we travel again to Istambul, weÂ´ll go again to Pierre Loti Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the off season”
Reviews.Author: brando101
Reviews.Content: A nice small hotel in a prime location in the old quarter. Stayed there in January 2012 and the rooms were heavily discounted. Weather was still pleasant, and no crowds. Our tour guide said that in summer, fall and holidays, the lines at attractions can be 1-2 hours long. We never waited. The Pierre Lotti is two blocks from just about everything in the old quarter and has a rooftop restaurant that has panoramic views. Rooms are small, but what made that inconvenient was that there were no drawers. If it did hang up, it stayed in our suitcase. The beds were abnormally firm and the sheets felt cheap ( do they make a 50 thread count?) But otherwise, the hotel is stylish and friendly, in good shape, and easy to get to. As long as you get a good deal online, you'll be happy. Saw their rack rate of 200 euros a night posted at the front desk, but couldn't imagine anybody much over 100 for this place- even in season.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: M S
Reviews.Content: excellent location, the staff was friendly and welcoming but the room was small for 3 persons and it was too damp

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Xavier Z
Reviews.Content: room is clean but too small. location is good, very near to the blue mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and Superb location”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller2088
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. Staff were really friendly and welcoming, room was spacious and clean, location was superb! I have been to Istanbul more times then I can remember, this was certainly the best hotel that I have stayed in so far and I will stick using them in future after this good experience. Wireless was really fast, which was really necessary for my job! The only negative is the lack of variety available during breakfast. For a 4* hotel they should really have more selection available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the center of culture”
Reviews.Author: Nadia d
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel in the center of old Istanbul. You can reach the highlights of Istanbul by feet. The reception and service is good, also the rooms are good. Breakfast is okay, but could use more variety. We had a streetview room. very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: natandmatt
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, in between Grand Bazaar and Aya Sofia. Walking distance to each is about 5 minutes. Although the hotel is just off the main street, it's very quiet. We had a "standard" double room, with a discounted rate, so the room was VERY small and dark, facing the back. Very clean hotel. Decor is tired and boring, but pretty standard for this type of hotels. Excellent fresh breakfast with lots of variety in a beautiful bright roof restaurant. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect..”
Reviews.Author: jahhaaf
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a perfect view, place, price,rooms,restaurant,services,hospitality and wireless high speed internet. but still having some defects in the breakfast meals.

Reviews.Title: “pierre's review”
Reviews.Author: PierreCavalini
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good (value for money). The roof terras is amazing and the location perfect. Only the matrasses are quite hard.

Reviews.Title: “Small but elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maurice K
Reviews.Content: Overall we were highly pleased with the attentiveness of the staff, the cleanliness of the property and its terrific location in the Sultanahmet area (with all major attractions in walking distance). The breakfast gave plenty of choices in European fashion. The rooms are SMALL. With the tiny full sized bed in place, there was very little room around the perimeter of it for walking. The tiny table and desk are helpful, but the chair is always a challenge to bang into one piece of furniture or another. We did have one minor misunderstanding which started us off on a bad footing. We were presented with a coupon for a "Welcome Cocktail" in the rooftop bar. We went there that night and chose cocktails from the bar menu, only to be told they meant a specific "Welcome Cocktail" concoction prepared for guests. That miscommunication cost us about 25 lira and I felt a reputable business would have said, "We're sorry for not communicating or printing on the coupon what we meant -- we will take the loss." They were adamant about payment so we had little choice but to absorb it. Needless to say, we did not give the hotel a single lira of additional business for meals or spa services if they treated guests that way -- making us pay for their mistakes.

Reviews.Title: “More than nice people”
Reviews.Author: Dodiq
Reviews.Content: I would like to say hundred sentences about the hotel , but the most thing I like is the people who work there , they are so smily and nice in their treatment . Specially a lady called ( lutfiye ) if I M not mistaken in her name spell . Anyway just 1000 thanks to you pierre loti hotel

Reviews.Title: “Spa is wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: Margrit H
Reviews.Content: Visiting the hamam with kese was great after the citytour. We also took a wonderfull massage (Anna did her work really good). The view from the roof restaurant is overwhelming. Small rooms, no place to unpack our suitcases. We enjoyed our stay there very much.

Reviews.Title: “Go there for it's location.”
Reviews.Author: AnotherMark
Reviews.Content: You can't find a better located hotel in old Istanbul. 5 min. walk to Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Tokapi, etc. Great restaurants nearby. Tram stops a block away. Those are the reasons to choose this hotel. But... 1. Rooms are very small. Stayed a week and there was no room or place to unpack suitcases. No dresser or cabinets in room for storage. Just a very small closet to hang a few things. 2. Breakfast was nothing special. Basic items. Hot items often ran out and it took a while before staff replenished them. 3. Room cleaning was not the best. Found items on floor and in hair in sink from previous guest. The daily room cleaning was not up to our expectations. On a positive note, front desk staff was helpful. We received a very good room rate thru a special sale.

Reviews.Title: “Most fantastic stay in Turkey thanks to the help of the Hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: sayeed c
Reviews.Content: This hotel i would say has got one of the most friendly staff that i have encountered, in all my travels. I have spent a lot of time in hotels but the the service at this hotel was fantastic. When we checked we were given a warm welcome and in depth explanation was give to us of what to visit and how to do so which helped us for the rest of our trip. When travelling with children sometimes it can be really difficult, but the staff made our daughter feel really special. The rooftop restaurant has got on of the best views in Istanbul. The location of the hotel is very good 5 minutes away from most ammenities and tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: vgebrev
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with excellent service, nice rooms and very close to a lot of must-see tourist attractions. Having delicious buffet breakfast while enjoying the spectacular view from the top floor is a great way to start your day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Friendly...”
Reviews.Author: CardiffDA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated just off the main drag in Sultanahmet, less than 200m from the Ã‡emberlitaÅŸ tram stop. It is ideal for sight seeing - The Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia and the Topkapi Palace are all approximately 500m away. Because of its proximity to the Ã‡emberlitaÅŸ tram stop, it is easy to get to other districts in Istanbul. I stayed here for a week and found the room comfortable, the breakfasts good and filling and the staff very friendly and helpful. I do not speak any Turkish and so the fact that all staff were able to speak English was very useful. The jewel in this hotel's crown has to be the rooftop bar with its views across the city and its friendly and relaxed atmosphere. And a special mention must go to one of the bar staff, Eyyup, who took the time to recommend places to visit, explain customs and culture and to just chat with guests. If I go back to Istanbul, I will certainly check availability at this hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Elbkiesel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 10 days during the Ramadan period in August 2011 and enjoyed my stay very much. The hotel is located directly in the heart of the Sultanamet region, very close to the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia and the Topkapi palace. The location is truly great! Very central, still quite. The hotel staff is very friendly. The rooms are a bit on a small side, but still large enough for two people, are very clean and equipped with air condition (which is really nice to have in August in Istanbul). Food for breakfast was good, the breakfast room is very light and allows to see see the bosphorus. In the evening, the roof-top terrace provides a nice view of Istanbul at night. I booked the hotel via expedia, for a special price of 38 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: furmi
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in Pierre Loti Hotel in the Sultanamet region of Istanbul in June 2011. The Hotel staff were very friendly and nothing was to much trouble. The bedrooms, although very small, were clean and comfortable. There was plenty of choice for breakfast so even the fussiest eaters should be able to fill up before setting off on a full day of sight seeing! The location of the hotel is perfect for all the important sights. The Tram stop is just on the doorstep, but , you hardly hear the noise of trams and they stop running between midnight and 6 in the morning. Traveling on the tram is is great for getting around Istanbul, but be preared to stand and don't be put off by a sweating armpit in your face, afterall it's half the fun of Istanbul! The famous Blue Mosque is a few minutes walk down the road from Pierre Loti and you have a wonderful view of this from the roof top terrace in the hotel. Explore the Grand Bazaar, a short walk up the road and don't forget the Spice Bazaar near the marina. Expect to Haggle in the markets and never pay the asking price for anything. There a plenty of lovely restaurants within walking distance fo the hotel serving tastey traditional Turkish dishes. Currency exchange is quick and easy, but avoid this in the banks and hotel as the rates are often more favourable in the kiosks in the town. Boat trips are cheap when booked directly at the marina rather than at the hotel and offer a great way to explore the Bosphorus and the beautful sights. Have fun and enjoy Istanbul. If you love Turkey, Istanbul won't disappoint. It reall is Turkey at it's best

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: Alex B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well placed in walking distance to some of the best points of interest. The room is nice, clean and comfy. The personnel was kind and there was always someone to ask if you had a question - they really took good care of us. The view from the rooftop terrace and breakfast room is magnificant since the hotel is one of the highest buildings around.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Spritzerr66
Reviews.Content: Visited Istanbul for the second time this year and choose this hotel as location sounded better. We were not disappointed, its location is fab, right in the centre next to bazaar and main street with plenty of restaurants and cafes. Hotel room quite small but sufficient for weekend stay, hotel had small bar and helpful friendly reception staff. Did not eat in the hotel but menu looked nice. Had breakfast which was ok, not too bad choice. Typically turkish. Istanbul is bustling and has a nice atmosphere, plenty of sites to visit and lots of shopping available if you want to. If you are after a nice big sparkly diamond then this is the place. There are literally hundreds of jewellery shops in the bazaar. There are some good restaurants in the main street, many have good menus with lots of fish available. We visited the blue mosque and other places, a good city to go to with a friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service but Needs Refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: Quadrato
Reviews.Content: Pierre Loti's location is peerless and one of the best in Istanbul, near the most important tourist sites such as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the Grand Bazaar. The view from the rooftop restaurant is outstanding. The Hotel staff was quiete helpful, friendly and knowledgeable, though restaurant service was slow. The rooms are in need of remodeling with worn down carpets, curtains and bedspreads and occasionally cranky air-conditioning. Even taking account of these factors, Pierre Loti is advisable and good value if one wishes to be in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “What a location !!”
Reviews.Author: tibre_89
Reviews.Content: Dear all, We were lucky to have located this wonderful hotel just a hop. step and jump from the Blue Mosque in the Sultan Ahmet area. Its 5 mins walk to this fabulous mosque, 2 mins walk from the Cemberlitas tram station. Plenty of cafes and shopping within arms reach. The hotel itself was very clean, with well appointed rooms. Very good service at the desk. The manageress very graciously allowed us a late check out which eased our travel woes considerably. Breakfast could have been better, but there is still plenty and more to eat. Highly recommend this place to anyone who wishes to stay where the action is yet not have hordes of people and noise.

Reviews.Title: “Staff make the difference”
Reviews.Author: LVinWA
Reviews.Content: Pierre Loti's lucky to have these staff: if they're not hired away by the nearby Ritz, enjoy their gracious hospitality. The manager is fantastic. Great breakfast, clean rooms, of course location, location, location. We pre-arranged airport p/u & d/o through their driver after some negative experiences listed online: so glad we did. A little extra, but noooo hassle (priceless!) Can't say enough about the service!

Reviews.Title: “Great and unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: MaurizioCara
Reviews.Content: The hotel is run by a superlative staff, always available, really kind and friendly expecially the real professional Pinar who spent energy to organize a good staying for my group of 12 persons. The hotel position is the best you'll find in Istanbul, close to everything you need to see if you have only three or four days. You may reach any destinations by foot, even Galata Bridge or use the tram line easily for only YTL 1,75 (less than 1 euro). Rooms are excellent, the area around there is really quiet in night even if Divanyolu Caddesi is crowded during daytime, the terrace is an unforgettable experience and having breakfast looking at Aya Sofya is an heartbreaking view. This hotel is one of the best I have seen in my traveling life.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy hotel in the best place”
Reviews.Author: HadiaK
Reviews.Content: The location is the excellent. All main attractions (like: Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, several museums, Grand Bazaar and ...) are in walking distance (10-15 minutes) also there are lots of different restaurants around. The tram station in about 150 meters distance from hotel enables you to use public transportation if you want to go to other sites. The staff of hotel are helpful and friendly and we had no problem in this hotel. As hotel located beside the main street, there are many noises till 2 AM. It was not a big problem for us but someone may find it difficult to sleep. Hotel has roof restaurant and pub which has good view to the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “HIghly recommended for a weekend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: becks060
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend and found the hotel perfect for our stay. It is the perfect location for the main sites, all of which are in walking distance. The staff were delightful ... welcoming, helpful & friendly. Rooms were clean and a good size and the roof terrace was the perfect place to relax after a day sightseeing. Highly reccommended

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ismo45
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was very good. The restaurant food offer was poor. Room was nice, but there was small water problem in the window wall.

Reviews.Title: “Basic , you are paying for the location”
Reviews.Author: LondonAllison
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Istanbul with my 30 year old daughter. The room was basic, although there was a safe in the wardrobe it was really non existent. The breakfast was plentiful and the staff helpful and the roof is pleasant to sit at.The location is right n the main road and within walking distance of the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar. The tram runs right outside which is an easy way to get around. The most annoying thing was the curtains didn't quite cover the windows so the light came in and I prefer my room dark. All trips on the tram , funicular and metro are 1.75 TL you just buy a token at the Jeton machine. We did a cooking course which lasted about 3 hours and then after cooking a 5 course meal we all sat down and ate together , thoroughly enjoyable. Went to the ha man as well on the main road although found it way too busy in fact the slab was so full I had someone's feet on my head., the massage was great though. I would try next time to pick the time, the middle of the day seemed to be a lot less full. Having travelled a lot in Asia and very use to bargaining I found the bazaar owners very reluctant to bargain, maybe they are too use to tourist just paying the asking price. The carpet dealers were much more open to bargaining and managed to cut the price down 50%. Taksim is worthwhile going too and found a great restaurant upstairs called Fayre., it only had locals and the food was fantastic.They also gave us a free taste of Raki the staff were very helpful ..There are so many restaurants ,don't forget to look up as most are above the shops. All in all a worthwhile visit and I found Istanbul to be quite safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: olindoteixeira
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Small rooms but comfortable. Good breakfast. Staff very helpful and friendly. Hotel highly recommended. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Pierre Loti Hotel is in a great location with the tram line only metres away (don't worry you cant really hear it). The staff are friendly and very helpful. Rooms are small but that is the "norm" in the old city, they are clean and the bathroom is well appointed if not small! There is a fantastic view of the city from both the breakfast room and bar on the top floor of the hotel. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, and in the perfect location if on foot”
Reviews.Author: normski1954
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations, although it is small the staff are very well trained and nothing was to much trouble for them to deal with. The rooms are small but fine for spending the night to sleep in, but would be cramped to spend all day if the weather is bad. The menu was rather limited for a long staying guest but if you speak to the staff they are willing to cook you anything you like that is not on the menu. Ali the barman and waiter of the roof top bar, will take care of anything you need and guide you to places that might be of interest to the visitor. He is a mind of information and it is well worth spending a night in the bar talking to him and getting the low down on the places to visit in Istanbul. When I return to Istanbul I will book this hotel again, it is very well run, and the staff are a credit to the management and hotel owners.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location for visiting historic district of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: wyllieohagan
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming and friendly service. Hotel in an excellent location within walking distance of many historic sites, plus good public transport links for visiting further afield. Rooms small but perfectly fine for short trip. Lovely warm bedroom was most welcome in snowy Istanbul:) Stunning views of the city from the top floor cafe/bar restaurant. Istanbul is not a quiet, sedate city. One could hear the city noise in the bedroom, even though there is no through traffic on the side of the hotel we stayed in. Imagine this would be the case in all of the hotels in this neighbourhood. Would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Again, it's not 4 Stars u would expect, it's Turkish 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: MaxKevin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in late Dec, and after reading the manager's eager response, I have to echo the previous two "negative reviews", it really is not a 4 stars hotels u would expect from Crown Plaza, Hilton or Marriot, it's 2 stars at most. I will only speak on my own room experience. The location is really good, and the staffs are all very helpful and welcoming. I have't got a bad word to say about then, but my "Comfort Double for single use with City View" was really dated and tiny beds. The tram and AC noises are unmissable. I just hope the booking website in the UK could specify it's Turkish 4 stars rating, so you won't have the false expectation of the ususal 4 stars standards. You do get what you paid for in this city, so I would definitely go for an international chain hotel in Istanbul next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: NOLA30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three days in July. The location is very convienient and the service was fantastic.when I booked the reservation I called the Front Office department and spoke with one lady named Lutfiye (I guess that was her name) I cant describe such as a great customer service this lady provided me.The staff went out of their way to make sure that our stay was comfortable and that we were well taken care of while we were there. We are looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but definitely not a 4-star”
Reviews.Author: delfing
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located for sightseeing, 5 minutes away from the Blue Mosque or Ayasofya and from a tram stop that can take you to Taksim. The good ends here. The rooms in the hotel are small and feature dated furniture and smelly carpet which probably dates from Pierre Loti times. The bathroom is the one you would expect in a backpackers hostel (or not even!), with mould growing in parts of the shower, shower sink directed to under the WC and a WC brush which I have no words to describe (but a picture for you to check) Cleanliness in the room when we arrived was not too good, and daily cleaning (if any) was very superficial. In the late afternoon and evening there is no housekeeping at all. One day the maid removed all the towels without replacing them so we called reception to get some. It took 3 hours and 4 phone calls to get the towels in the room, which in fact only happened when I got seriously angry at the receptionist. The breakfast choice is very limited and fresh juices and omelettes/scramble eggs are only available at a supplement. The view from the rooftop bar is good but nothing special, and the welcome drink is to be avoided. I will come back to Istambul but for sure not to this hotel as I think you can find much better value in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Just a good place”
Reviews.Author: wingas
Reviews.Content: 1. The hotel is perfectly located. 2. Friendly staff. Good room service. 3. In the roof pub - a beautiful view! 4.Special thanks to the waiter Ali, for good service and our excellent feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Most memorable trip to Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Sammy22Lancashire
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Istanbul three hours late due to the adverse weather conditions throughout Europe. Upon arrival, we found that the driver who had been arranged by the hotel for a free Airport transfer dad been waiting all this time. Astonishingly, he had no complaint whatsoever. In fact, he was more than happy to give us a guide tour during the forty five minute trip between the airport and the hotel. Great start! Upon arriving at the hotel, their was an instant appreciation of the difficulties we had had in getting there. Check-in took more than five minutes for ten people which we really appreciated. There were some details which the hotel required from us, however, we were told that we could provide these once we were settled in. The hotel itself was located in the most ideal of locations considering we were on a sightseeing trip of the city. It is centrally located to most of the recommended places worth visiting, many of which are within walking distance. Once inside, the hotel is very quiet. This was most surprising considering the hotel was fully booked. We had three triple rooms where we were more than comforatable. The rooms are not the biggest we have stayed in, howeevr, they are more than manageable. The room & the hotel is very clean throughout. What we enjoyed & appreciated the most was the willingness of the staff always being at hand to help. One example of this was when we arrived back at the hotel at 2am with my partner barely being able to walk having walked into a bollard. The Reception Manager (Muharram)was happy to send someone to the Pharmacy to get an ice pack for us. Once we realised that it was not nearby we declined but we had a bag full of ice cubes delivered to our room within two minutes. And then there was the Reservations Manager (Pinar) who ended up taking full responsibilty for out itinerary during our stay. She was constanly intersted in what we had planned for the day and then built a plan for us around that having taken the trouble to genuinely understand the things we enjoyed doing. If I have to be critical, particulary considering the trip had been made in December during their winter was the fact that we could not get the room cool when we felt hot. This may wel have been down to me not being able to operate the Air Con'. We cannot recommend Istanbul or the Pierre Loti Hotel enough. We are already planning our trip back there for summer 2011.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY THE BEST POSSIBLE CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: ginger_lane19
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews before writing this to make sure i was being fair and honest. First of all, only one review from a girl from greece was utterly ridiculous. I was there for ten days, the same time that she was there. The staff was great when my mini bar would not stay cold. Switched it immediately. Room was immaculately clean. Don't know how she got a room with a small window...i had two long french windows that opened. View from the room was amazing. Room was absolutely a good size as European rooms go. Had plenty of space with a brand new double bed, desk, two night tables, and small cafe table with chairs. Carpeting was immaculately clean( I wear white socks and can attest to this). Linens were spotless. No smell or odor in the room. Breakfast had excellant choices...typical european breakfast. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Food and view in the restuarant on the roof were both great. Even ordered room service, and it was outstand quality and service. On the downside, in all fairness, was the resturant hostess (a blonde girl)...took my order, never brought me my bottled water, left me sitting while she proceeded to scream and I mean scream in her cellphone. She paced around the restaurant the whole time screaming in her cellphone. Still no water. Thank God for the waiter, who was kind and amazing or I would still be sitting there waiting. The hostess proceeded to use her cellphone while I ate my dinner...still screaming. Really rude to the guests. Definitely did not want to work with the guests. I feel badly for all the rest of the staff, as she was the ONLY disappointment..I would NEVER keep her employed in that capacity, as she did not care for the guests, and was not up to the standard of the rest of the employees who knocked themselves out for the guests. I would never consider staying anywhere else but here. Staff and hotel were both amazing! Location is the best in Istanbul. I am probably considered one of those picky Americans and am very particular where I stay, and I have stayed everywhere in the world. If it met my satisfaction, it would certainly meet anyone elses. Choose this hotel...you cannot go wrong!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel next to the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: Virgichan
Reviews.Content: Great location and amazing view from the bar terrace. Most rooms face the main street but we stayed in a room in a corner and it was pretty dark. Apart from that, the service is great and there's free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: vanessadam
Reviews.Content: Certainly not a 4 star hotel. The room was extremely small,there was hardly enough space to move or to leave your luggages. Tinny double bed, forget it if you are tall, uncomfortable pillows, the worst sleep i ever had in a hotel. Carpet was dirty, small wardrobe and small bathroom. Additionally the whole room smelled mold from the water which was dripping from the air conditioner! Small window, you could hardly breathe. Poor breakfast with extra charges! The only thing was worthing its money was the perfect view from the bar- restaurant at the last floor, really astonishing! Also hotel parking was cheap. The location was perfect, five minutes walking from the most important sightseeings.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: clubcouture
Reviews.Content: stayed at pierre lotti for a short busness trip and really enjoyed it . must say ali the barman on rooftop terrace bar is a great guy very friendly especially as i was travelling alone and really made my stay so enjoyable ,and must mention the lovely girl on reception who was incredibly helpful and brilliant at her job , thank you so much steve barry guest 3rd to 7th november 2110

Reviews.Title: “all good here”
Reviews.Author: thetravelleraaa
Reviews.Content: An ideal hotel with good central location and on the tram line. The staff were genuinely sincere and always helpful and it was always a pleasure to see them. A good bar and restaurant on the roof with another good one below although this is owned by someone else. Good value but I think I might have been lucky when I walked in. Would certainly go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Base for Vacation in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: napetersen1
Reviews.Content: Very cute boutique hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet. Walk to many of the top attractions including the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Great restaurants right outside your door. A block away from a Cemberlitas Hamami which was one of the highlights of the trip. really cool restaurant and bar at the top of the Pierre Loti with view of Istanbul. The room was small and bed a little hard but I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good food and value for money, this hotel is superbly placed for a city break,”
Reviews.Author: rosevine
Reviews.Content: The staff, both at reception and in the restaurant, were most obliging and attentive. The restaurant offers a good menu and the food is well prepared and presented. Our room, although a little small was adequate and serviced well. Pierre Loti is extremely well located, most of Istanbul's attractions are within walking distance. I f we visit Istanbul again we would be very happy to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Sylvie19590724
Reviews.Content: Hotel service was excellent-well greeted upon arrival, friendly and smiling staff and eager to help. Provided detailed info regarding tramway, internet keyboard Turskish. Also offered to print our boarding pass upon chekin-on line for departure. Our room no. 402 on 4th floor on side street was perfect. Much quieter then front street with tramways and lots of activities. Windows in room were great, 2 single beds were comfortable, a bit small the room but very adequate. Location was just perfect ! all within walking distance to different amenities, we truly appreciated it. What we liked best was being close to amenities and the comfort of the hotel. We enjoyed the roof top terrasse at night, with a beautiful view. What we liked least was the same breakfast buffet, every single day, not one item different on display, a bit boring towards the end of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms so-so”
Reviews.Author: twiggels
Reviews.Content: My grandfather stayed in the Pierre Loti repeatedly in the 1960s, so as a family tribute this was the choice for Istanbul, particularly as we picked up quite a reasonable rate at short notice. Unfortunately, it appears that while they have done some renovations since the 1960s (not all Turkish hotels have done that), they also made the rooms much much smaller. The bathrooms were a bit dated. Overall probably better than average Istanbul standard, but nothing I would call 4*. Tip to the hotel management: if you decide to offer a 'free welcome cocktail' in the rooftop bar make it something alcoholic and not a multicoloured 'fruit'-punch suitable to delight a four-year old. A glass of wine or beer would not have broken the bank and we might have had a few more instead of retreating to our rooms to gargle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in the Old City, close to all sights and plenty of restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Sajdaj2000
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Istanbul and I think staying at this hotel was a good choice overall. It was smack bang in the middle of all the historic buildings, all within walking distance. Is located in Sultanahmet, close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the Grand Bazaar. Whilst our visit to Istanbul Ramadan started, which was great, the atmosphere was great, there was entertainment put on near the Blue Mosque everynight which seemed to be telvised somewhere, but this was happening all around. Just outside the hotel, just before the fast was broken a band of four ment would recite some religious verses with musical instruments, it was great! I was concerned that maybe shops etc would be closed during the day, but all were open, just note, Grand Bazaar closed on Sunday, else most shops still open. It was a great atmosphere for families, couples etc. The tram ran outside and had stops very close by, one to the left and one to the right which was very slightly downhill. As you come out of the Hotel and walk up the main street to the tram stop on the left, just infront of the stop at the side is the kiosk from where you purchase the plastic coins you need to use the Tram. It costs about Â£1.50 a coin. You use one coin for your trip to where ever you are going, whether it is 1 stop away or 20 stops away. The trams are airconditioned too. Rooms in the hotel are cosy, but did the job, the room was cleaned everyday and fresh towels left too. Is a basic ensuite with a shower, but hey, does the job. Beds were a little uncomfortable, but then again, I find that any bed that is not mine uncomfortable. Breakfast is basic, this was a bit dissapointing, it always seemed a bit random, who has fries for breakfast? Well that was one of the options on everyday. Otherwise, lots of bread, cheese, jam, honey, boiled eggs, cereal, olives. On the occasion got tomatoes with melted cheese, mushrooms with melted cheese and fries! You could order omellettes at an extra cost of 10-15 Liras, which we did order once, OK, but not worth getting again. Cordials available, but if you wanted freshly squeezed orange juice it was extra. We used to go out and have freshly squeezed juices at a much lower price and they were lovely, plently available. Staff were pleasant and spoke good english. There is a PC available in the reception area for you to use and access the Internet. Was going to use the spa facilities but never got the time as were out and about most the time till late, so just didnt get round to it so cant tell you much on that. Airconditioning was fine, I know it runs on a system that the airconditioning/electrics switch off when you take out the key card, but then why have it on and waste electricity when you are out all day, yes the room is a little stuffy on your return, but soon cools down. The room did have a refrigerator, but it was not cold, things were just slightly cool, so was disappointed with this, as I needed to drink chilled water as the water did not taste very nice (bottled water), had to find a shop that sold cordial to put in my bottled water. The people are very friendly, just speak to them with respect just how you would want to be spoken to. Taxis, haggle the prices as with the prices when shopping, you will learn where to and where not too, but taxi drivers will charge you a lot so dont ever pay what they ask for and sort the price out in advance. All in all, great place, will do it again, but remember Istanbul is not cheap, yes somethings may be, but restaurants are about the same as the UK. Just one personal note, whilst we were there, a lady sold some knitted socks and such items just to the left of the Hotel, she would be there everyday in the baking sun, all day, with her son who was in a wheelchair. On our last day, we wanted to give her some money and take maybe a pair of socks so it didnt look too much like charity, but she wasnt there! She was there everyday from about 9am until late afternoon, but we were unfortunate to not meet her before we left. If you do see her, don't make the same mistake we did, buy something from her. Have a good holiday and stay ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Legendary Turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Veterinaru
Reviews.Content: Well, my staying in this lovely hotel was one of the best experience in Turkey. The breakfast is very basic with some items extra (if you want more - an omeletten for example, you should pay 10-15 TL). The staff are very good English speakers, even Romanian :)

Reviews.Title: “Bad Air-conditioning otherwise very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeSFSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel which is reasonably priced BUT too cost conscious. Only provide 1 room key no matter how many people as they have a HVAC system that shuts off within 60 seconds of leaving the room. This makes for a very uncomfortable room when one comes back from a day of sightseeing and the room never gets comfortable. Trick is to leave the key in the HVAC gizmo and claim that you forgot the key. They dispense a person to open the room pretty quickly. Soap and bathroom incidentals are also low priority so bring your own favorite shampoo and other bathroom items. Still very convenient to the "Old City" and a great location

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, great location, nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: younissaima
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with a warm welcome and fruit cocktails and then shown to our room which was slightly on the small side but big enough, and very nicely decorated in a modern Turkish style. Breakfast was nice, and the views from the roof top were amazing! The staff would do anything for you, give you directions, help with booking anything, or just a good old chat. The hotel was in walking distance to all the major attractions, Topkapi palace, the Blue Mosque, The museum, and the Bazaar. When you come out of the hotel you'll find plenty of places to eat all along the main road. Try the restaurant Safran where old Turkish ladies make the Turkish Bread infront of you and the place has a real turkish feel. Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location. Istanbul is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: StuartFromKirkham
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for 1 night after reading good reviews on the Air Miles web site. Then nearer the time I read some poor reviews on Trip Advisor (over-booking, small room size, noise and poor breakfast). Arriving late on Grand Prix day, I was a little apprehensive but there was not a booking problem. We were given room 103 (photo uploaded) which was on a corner of the building and hence had two window bays with a desk in one and a chair and table in the other. The room was therefore a good size and had plenty of space on the floor for a large hard case. The room overlooked the main road (trams and a few slow cars / vans) at the front of the hotel with the Cemberlitas tram station about 100m away. Yes there was some noise but not enough to be a problem. The buffet breakfast was adequate. It was a shame that omelettes and cappuchinos, both of which I enjoy, were (clearly marked) extras. So none of the concerns raised by the poor reviews were a problem for me (although I can understand that for some they may be) and I definitely would consider staying here again, especially for the excellent location. A tip for travelling to the hotel from the airport. Take the metro from the airport to Zeytinburnu (fare 1.5 TL) and then the tram to Cemberlitas (not Sultanahmet) (fare also 1.5TL). The tram starts at Zeytinburnu and therefore far less likely to be crowded than if changing at Aksaray and the hotel is nearer the Cemberlitas stop than Sultanahmet. The jetons for the Metro can be used on the tram (but not the ferries).

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: stephaniecarboni
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a friend's hen weekend at the end of May and was very impressed with the service we received. The receptionists at the desk catered for our every need, be it taxi booking, phoning leisure centres in Istanbul or ensuring we got a good price at a hair salon nearby. The hotel's roof-top bar was also a fantastic experience with great food and very accomodating and friendly service. This hotel would be good for couples, families and friends travelling together. Rooms were very decent for the price and the location, right in the heart of old Istanbul, was perfect for sight-seeing. Stay here and you won't be dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel with friendly staff in a conveniently placed location”
Reviews.Author: seahawk99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently placed to provude easy access to the major places of interest in the city. It is small, well-appointed and the staff are friendly and helpful. Our room was on the small side with limited storage space, but was clean and pleasantly furnished. The roof pub was a delighttful feature with excellent views across the city and the harbour and provided good food. The breakfast room was light and airy and provided a good range of food to start the day. The staff were clean, smart and efficient. We were well pleased with our choice of hotel for our 3-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay for a weekend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Peamoth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely comfortable and one of the few hotels outside of the UK we've ever stayed in which offers tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Staff very efficient - outstanding service from the Reception Staff who are always happy to help. Restaurant is excellent and is situated on the 5th floor giving a wonderful view over Istanbul. Free internet access in the lobby. Well located for tourists as it is close to the main sites (Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia Mosque) and just a few minutes walk from the Grand Bazaar. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.l

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: nomadiccouple
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean but service is very ordinary. the first day the curtain got loose as couple of hooks had come off, but this was never fixed all through our stay. Breakfast is very very minimalistic with everything from fresh fruit juice to omlette etc being 'extra' The photos on their website is very misleading, do not expect anything like that. The major plus is the location, it is bang close to everything. OK hotel to stay in if you are running out of options ( as we were for the easter weekend) , BUT definitely not a first choice...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: haniakil
Reviews.Content: I visit Istanbul frequently (every 3 months or so) and I always stay in different hotels, but this time I stayed at the Pierre Loti Hotel. The location is excellent... it's right in the middle of Sultanahmet. The staff members are professional, helpful and friendly (All the way from the Manager down the chain). I would recommend it to a friend. This is what I'd say about the hotel overall: - It's clean & safe - Excellent location - Reasonably priced - Has a small gym but I was happy to use a treadmill

Reviews.Title: “Breath taking views.........................”
Reviews.Author: Samo_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent service the staff were very helpful and they had a good understanding of english, which was useful. The hotel was very clean and our room had reasonable room space. Excellent location for shopping, dining and sight seeing. The tram was very cheap ..... I reccomend a turkish bath at this hotel as it was fantastic ! This hotels breakfast buffet was very tasty and catered for all taste buds. The food overall was very good at this hotel. I also enjoyed McDonalds as it was 5mins walk from this hotel especially if you have children as they love that place. My worst experience was eating out at Sultanahmet restaurant a lamb shish which was undercooked and had a horrible smell to it . Obviously nothing to do with this hotel but extra information for you guys out there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: ZoeB2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a 2-3 night stay in Istanbul...2 minutes from the Blue Mosque right in the heart of sultanahmet the location couldn't have been better. The roof garden gave amazing views of the city and fantastic in the sun in the afternoon listening to the calls to prayer. The rooms were small, but perfectly adaquate if sighseeing is your main purpose for visiting. 'Adonis' restaurant comes highly recommended and is close by...5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SafaMike
Reviews.Content: This hotel's best feature is its location. It is an easy walk to all of the main tourist attractions in and around Sultanahmet. And if walking is not your thing, the tram stops a 100 yards up the road and will take you close to anywhere you want to go. The rooms met all our needs (as we don't generally spend a lot of time in our rooms); tea & coffee, shower (no bath), safe, air con, TV and was clean. My only complaint would be that the bed was a bit too hard for my liking. The buffet breakfast had a Turkish feel with a lot of cheeses, bread, cold meats, olives, etc but also cooked sausages, tomato, mushrooms and boiled eggs. There were omeletts available at an extra charge (8TL). Their juices I found very sweet but for an extra charge(5TL) there was a medley of freshly squeezed juices. The Roof Top pub had the most wonderful views over the city and we found ourselves there every night for a nightcap (large beer 500ml 8TL) and a chance to reminisce on the day's events. The service we received was very satisfactory; the staff was helpful and polite. In short I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is more interested in a functional, practical and well situated hotel rather than a hotel draped in luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean hotel in great location. Disappointing room.”
Reviews.Author: tonyblackpool
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent location 5-10 mins walk from biggest sights (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar) Spectacular view from roof bar. Clean, well equipped, modern hotel. Good walk-in shower (no bath) Nice touches like free fruit cocktail on arrival, red rose on valentines day and comfy bath robes. Cons: Room was quite small with very little natural light having only one tiny window in the corner. Heating seemed to be stuck on with air conditioning not working. Noisy with window open - hence didn't sleep too well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: randy68
Reviews.Content: we stayed at PL this last week Jan 25-29, 2010 and could not find anything wrong in fact we were impressed by the service, cleanliness and overall conditions of the hotel. I don't know what some people have complained about but all I can tell you they run a first class hotel. Even a little item as the shower stall backing up a bit and they were there in 10 minutes to fix it. All the fixtures throughout the hotel are brand new and the sheets and towels (over sized and thick cotton) are the best I've ever seen in a hotel . Even the hotel bathrobes you get are the finest I've ever seen, not the cheap thin ones most hotels offer. Breakfast is standard fare of what you get in any hotel in Istanbul but again conditions are sparkling clean and food appetizing. And the location is the best for touring and transport. The complimentary drink they give you at the bar on your first night was a cheap fruit imitation but that's all I could really complain about.. and if that's all then its not really a complaint at all.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fedesha
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel and find location more important than facilities or even luxury than this is the place for you. I stayed here for a few days in 2007 and it was pretty much what we expected. A basic hotel in a good location, with good restaurants nearby and good connections with public transport. Oh, taxi drivers have no idea where the place is (or the street). Better prepare a little note with the name of the street and nearby streets. There is a lift, breakfast is basic but okay and because of its location it can be rather noisy. No, it is not a 4 star hotel. In Turkey they are rather generous with handing out stars. It is a 2-2 1/2 star hotel that offers small but clean rooms. Slightly overworked staff who don't speak English (but pretend they do by saying "yes" all the time and nodding sympathetically and being clueless at the same time). It was okay for me, especially because we booked the hotel as part of a very cheap package deal. But if you require a lot of personal attention and a true 4 star experience, don't go to the Loti Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Flower53_10
Reviews.Content: The Pierre Loti is a hotel situated exactly in heart of a tourist district of Istanbul, called Sultanahmet. There is a walking distance to haghia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, and Grand bazar. The hotel is very nice, the rooms are small, but clean, equipped with the frige. There is a Hamam in a hotel. The roof bar has a perfect view, so it's a very romatc place especially in the evnings. The breakfasts are not perfect, but OK. In general quite suitable hotel for tourists, but not for the business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nabilaPakistan
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location, its walking distance from all the important tourist sites. The area is also quaint. The hotel itself was nice, however the room we were given( and we were sharing it with our five year old son) was very small. It was nice and clean though and given that we travelled in winter was more than adequately heated. Breakfast was adequate, though became a little monotonous after 5 days of the same things( fresh juice and omelletes,fried eggs entail extra cost), Wi fi was free but was very slow, though free internet use in the lobby was a big help and it was not usually busy either. Did not eat in the hotel but alot of choices very near by. Staff was courteous but could have been a little more friendly and welcoming, but i thought that about Turkish people in general.

Reviews.Title: “BAD”
Reviews.Author: Visitster
Reviews.Content: We're here right now, as I write thie review. The pictures and description look excellent, but when you arrive, you will be very disapointed. The rooms are very small, dirty and the sewage smells horrible. After one night, we wanted to check-out, although we had a reservation made for 3 days. According to their WRITTEN policy, this would have been possible with a one night penalty - however, they threatened to charge the entire amount, which was already blocked in my credit card. Great!

Reviews.Title: “ideal location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lemmaUk
Reviews.Content: We found that this hotel has an excellent reputation in Istanbul, and it is well-deserved. We were delighted with our room, which was comfortable and quiet. The location, in an interesting neighbourhood and walking distance from all the major historical sites, could not have been better. The breakfast buffet included a few mediocre hot dishes, but the rolls, cheese, olives, and fresh fruit juices were delicious. We had some fabulous meals in restaurants recommended by the staff, and appreciated their friendliness and courtesy. I would certainly want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good views from the roof bar.”
Reviews.Author: dionysiusLondon
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and courteous & the rooms clean but not huge. The location is excellent for the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace & the Grand Bazaar. The tram stop is close by to get the Spice Bazaar & boat trips fron Kabatas. The roof bar has a fine view over the roof tops over the city. The turkish bath & massage in the basement is excellent. The buffet breakfast is good & plenty of it. Probably the receptionist could have smiled a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: annakatrine
Reviews.Content: Check in time was 1pm but they let us in early (9am) at no extra cost, Great location as Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofya, Grand Bazaar, Dervish cafe, Cistern and Cemberlitas Hammam a short stroll away. Room was tiny but who spends time in their room whilst in Istanbul? Tea and coffee in room, adequate bathroom with toiletries and TV. No noise from the street. Only view of the Mosque is from the rooftop bar - breakfast room does not quite have the same view. Lots of restaurants close by at a range of prices. Free internet PC in the lobby which was useful.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Psaraki
Reviews.Content: Nice accomondation, excellent location near sight seeing, very polite people.

Reviews.Title: “incredible experience, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LoloAntwerp
Reviews.Content: Would like to thank the Hotel fro giving me such a good service, for being so professinal and so sympathetic. I really had a problem and they went out of their way to help me like a was a friend, I'm a regular customer and not very often you get such a personalized service. many many thanks.This hotel is highly recommended Laurent

Reviews.Title: “ideal location good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimbohoho
Reviews.Content: We stayed between sep 21 and oct 3. had a great time the hotel was booked through expedia, the location was just perfect on the main road very close to the tram stop for Cemberlitas and within short walking distance of all the main attractions. The room was small but cosy, we had a corner room with windows at the front and side no noise from the street as they were double glazed.The staff were always pleasant and very helpful and spoke good english. they even found a pharmacy open on a Sunday and arranged a taxi to get me there and back at 9.30 in the morning, the breakfast was the usual buffet style with fresh orange juice and fresh cooked eggs at extra cost. The meals in the roof restraunt/bar were excellent and the service was very good. If you eat out at night there are numerous restraunts very close by in the side streets and on the main street (Divan Yolu) down towards the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia. Overall this was an excellent stay and we will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but small room. Rooftop restaurant difficult access, food not brilliant, view of mosque blocked.”
Reviews.Author: taidfali
Reviews.Content: The location is main thing about this hotel. Room very small,& would rate it 3star rather than 4 star. There are 2 lifts to the lobby- but both very small and especially if you have luggage as well. Eat our first night meal up in the roof top restaurant. Disappointing, views not all that impressive. Plenty of great restaurants nearby especially the Amedros- a few yards down the road on other side.Hotel however very clean and staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Location, Great Staff, Terrific City!”
Reviews.Author: Greybeardguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel Sept. 21 - 24 after four and one half weeks of travel in 10 countries. The Hotel is clean, modern, convenient, and the staff were very helpful, especially Ali at the roof top bar. We intended to try other locations for cocktail hour, but found nothing could beat the view and friendliness at our hotel. Highly recommended! David and Diana Finlay from Vancouver, B.C.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe good reviews of this hotel - you may regret it.”
Reviews.Author: aroundtheworldnback
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location - perfect for visiting key sites in old Istanbul. Some of the staff are outstanding, but this is the end of of the positives my traveling companions and I could say about this hotel. The rooms in Pierre Loti are the smallest I have seen anywhere in the world. Our toilet was broken and we had to push to change rooms to one with working plumbing - they expected us to wait 24 hours for a plimber! The day manager is the rudest person I have ever come across in the hospitality industry (in which I also happen to work). Whilst the roof bar is great - the hotel has very strange restrictions on its opening and you will not get the opportunity to use it much. The breakfast is truly awful and they charge for real coffee, juice and cooked eggs - very strange. If you are going to stay at this hotel (because you really must), be sure to negotiate your room rate - this should not be more than 100Euros for any room regardless of the numbers staying in it. They will pretend they cannot negotiate - they can and will. We moved next door to the Saltanahmet Hotel for our last evening in the city - this was superior in every way and well worth the money (you should be able to negotiate a room rate of 150Euros for a double/triple room).

Reviews.Title: “Pierre Loti Hotel - Excellent Hotel, Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: turkishdelight404
Reviews.Content: We booked Pierre Loti Hotel independently after getting a sale price easyJet flight from Gatwick. If you book by email they offer 1 free airport transfer. I can recommend doing this as the pickup was really smooth and stress free. The hotel is in the perfect location - 5 mins walk from the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, trams, restaurants and other sights. Staff are really friendly and helpful. Remember you're in a city centre so don't expect large rooms. The rooms are clean and have air con but the walls are thin so you may get noise from next door (or you may be the ones making the noise for your neighbours). Hair dryers are provided as are towelling dressing gowns. The buffet breakfast is plentyful and in a room with a wonderful view. The rooftop bar also has wonderful views and the outside seating is perfect for catching the last rays of sunshine. We will definately be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: djloves2travel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly positioned to be easily able to walk to all major sights, yet very quiet as set back from the road. All staff I met were friendly and helpful. Great view from roof terrace bar and restaurant. Room small but clean and good aircon. Tram stops and loads of restaurants within 50m. Tram dead easy to use, cheap and airconed. Make sure you ask price of food and drink at the smaller cafes in the main squares before ordering. All other restaurants very professional with propper bills. Istanbul feels safe and unthreatening with loads to see. I came away wanting more and would stay at the Pierre Loti again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location- good services”
Reviews.Author: BucharestCris
Reviews.Content: we have chose the hotel for the good location and have found verry good services at the reception desk . It was a lovely tripp : excellent location and services

Reviews.Title: “great location but very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mazza59Australia
Reviews.Content: The location within walking distance of the main attractions is superb, but the hotel has many drawbacks. This is my first posting on tripadvisor and I rarely complain as I understand problems sometimes occur. However, it was fortunate that I had read on tripadvisor about another traveller's problem on checking in, involving an obvious scam, although I was disturbed to find it was not an isolated incident. We paid for five nights in advance and were told on arrival that there was a problem with several rooms so they would send us to another hotel for the night and hope a room would be available next day. After some heated words, a room miraculously became available. Something I hadn't read on tripadvisor was that there is a Mexican restaurant adjacent to the hotel, which plays loud music until midnight every night. Definitely not conducive to a good night's sleep. We had searched for a hotel with a shower not a bath (because of the safety in getting in and out) and thought this hotel would be suitable. Certainly it has a shower but there is a very high step into it so it is not recommended for anyone but the young and fit.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: STSOUN
Reviews.Content: Pros : though rooms were at the Medium size ( still enough space compared to the Paris or London ones) it's clean, comfortable,with friendly staff,unbeatable location,everything was as promised when booking.First choice when we get back to Istanbul. Cons : not big deal really but scrambled eggs/omelettes & fresh juices should be included in breakfast free of charge

Reviews.Title: “the hotel where you would love to come back”
Reviews.Author: Egerszeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed two times in Pierre Loti Hotel and in both occasions we were fully satisfied with the hotel facilities and services. The Hotel is located in the center of Sultanahmet, all touristic places are within a short walk. The Hotel has a newly built roof terrace from where the view of Istanbul is very beautiful. The Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Taksim, Bosphorus, Marmara Sea can also be seen. We could use one of the special packages offered by the Hotel. The breakfast was delicious with a wide range of cold and warm dishes. The Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful all the time especially Mr Burak Sevgi. :) See you next year! :)

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: huseyinakdeniz27
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, they have fantastic staff, the rooms are clean, the breakfast was amazing and the most selling point was that the hotel was near the tram and metro. Also the hotel was located near other pubs, restaurant, mosques, palaces and musea.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for the main Istanbul tourist trail”
Reviews.Author: paulmwestwood
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pierre Loti for five nights with my wife and five-year-old son, and was very impressed with all the services offered. The hotel's best point is the rooftop bar/breakfast room, which has really impressive panoramic views of the whole of Istanbul. The rooms are fine, certainly comparable with other 4 star hotels I've stayed in in other European cities, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is perfect - you can walk to the Blue Mosque / Hagia Sofia in two or three minutes, or catch a tram to the Galata bridge and beyond. The only possible criticism I can think of, which should definitely not prevent anyone from visiting this hotel, is that there's no area where you can sit and relax outside of your room, apart from the (two) bars. However, I would imagine most people don't visit Istanbul just to sit in their hotel, so this really isn't a major thing - and is true of most hotels. All in all, I would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone hoping to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, good quality-price relation! I recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: 94mm94mm94
Reviews.Content: Me and my mother stayed at Pierre Loti Hotel for 4 nights. Our first choice was Adonis Palace, but after reading some reviews here on TripAdvisor, we swap it really quickly. We arrived at 30thJune, around 11 p.m. and they showed our room. Although it was tiny, it was very comfortable. The room had two windows. In Turkey, the night isnâ€™t very dark, so we always had some â€œnight lightâ€� in the room. Related to the breakfast, I find it very normal (cereals, bread, cheese, jam, juices, coffee,â€¦), nothing special, just OK. The location is brilliant. Itâ€™s really in the heart of Sultanahmet. Itâ€™s very close to Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar. If youâ€™re a Starbucks addicted, you can find one really near and if you need to change some money, that wonâ€™t be a problem. Thereâ€™s a bank facility, open from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., really close to the hotel. The staff was very helpful. I only had a problem with the electricity, but then they explained me that I was placing the keycard in a wrong way. At the last day, around 4 a.m., we had problems with our transfer and the hotel staff helped us a lot. We arrived at the airport, at time, because of the proximity from the hotel to the Ataturk airport. Istanbul is a wonderful city and Turkish people are extremely nice! If youâ€™re attracted to the Turkish culture and if you like the fact of the city is located in two different countries, Europe and Asia, then go ahead and fly to Istanbul! I do not regret my choice. This hotel has a perfect location, a good quality-price relation and excellent views from the roof restaurant (You can see the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and so much more)! I recommend it for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Pierre Loti excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: GumbetScotland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Pierre Loti Hotel in June 2009 We had a wonderful stay. The hotel location is excellent being situated in the Sultanahmet area and within a few minutes walking distance of Topkapi Palace, theBlue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and Haghia Sophia. The hotel interior was beautiful; bedrooms were a bit small but very comfortable and immaculate; lovely breakfast area, and breakfasts were excellent; the hotel has a lovely rooftop restaurant and bar with with wonderful views over the city and all the staff were extremely helpful; Istanbul is a beautiful city, with wonderful history and very friendly people

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful views.”
Reviews.Author: jewelBerkshire
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel with friendly and helpful staff. The food was high quality and the restaurant, which was on the roof top had wonderful views. Recommended. Mr & Mrs Symonds

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend for anyone visiting the old city of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CJFB
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here and couldn't have asked for much better. Comfortable hotel, very helpful staff and the location was fabulous..near sights to see, shops and plenty of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul at its best”
Reviews.Author: Atrix
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful service at any time- wonderful roof terrasse with view over Istanbul. The breakfast was very good, turkish breakfast and choices between omelette, fresh orange juice etc. The room and bathroom war very clean and tidied regulary, nice room, rather small but just perfect for a city-trip. The Hotel is really well situated, we discovered the whole city by foot and tram, its really close to the "Big Basar" and to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: retirdprof
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about halfway between the Grand Bazaar (must visit) and the Topkapi Palace (also a must), right on the main tram line. It is run very professionally, the rooms are very clean and our stay in general was excellent. The complimentary breakfast is on the top floor with wonderful views of the ocean and Istanbul itself. Be careful when getting breakfast for the first time. There are items which require an extra charge such as omelettes, fresh orange juice and some coffees and if you are not aware of this when you first walk in it can be annoying. The large LCD TVs with a full range of international channels in the rooms are a real bonus. It is not the Hilton or Sheraton but overall it is a great value for the money

Reviews.Title: “'Food to die for and a view to live For'”
Reviews.Author: jeffmycock
Reviews.Content: Pierre Loti Hotel - Istanbul - Brilliant ! Right in the heart of the old city the Pierre Loti is superb. It is a really fine Hotel within a short walking distance of The 'Blue Mosqe', the wonderful 'Hagia Sophia' and the 'Topkapi Palace'. At the same time it is very quiet with all the modern facilities one would wish for, In particular is a new roof restaurant open to a spectacular view of the Blue Mosque and the waterfront of the city . The food was great and the service first class. Burak Sevgi, the front of house manager told us of the new 'external lift' about to be fitted to take guests straight up to the roof restaurant. Thanks Barak for an evening meal to remember ! Jeff Thomas with Thornleigh Travel

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: ChicciDublin
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the Pierre Loti Hotel, we were told that there were electrical problems with our room and we would have to stay in another hotel. Having read about similar experiences had by others on the trip advisor forum, we put up a bit of a fuss and asked to see the room. We were not allowed to see the room and were told that our only option was to stay in the alternative accomdation offered by the hotel. We were assured that this represented an upgrade and the hotel and room was in fact superior to the pierre loti. This couldn't be further from the truth. The hotel we were moved to was in an extremely dodgy area. The taxi couldn't even get close to the front door because of all the rubble surrounding the hotel and people sitting in the rubble. We couldn't leave the hotel. The room was unclean, noisy and the bathroom door locked itself shut when closed and could only be opened by a hotel employee so we were advised not to close it. After a dreadful night's sleep, we returned to the pierre loti at 8am the following morning, to be told that we couldn't check in until normal check in time as the room had to be cleaned. Clearly there had been people staying in it. The remainder of our stay in the pierre loti was just ok - it's very basic with no frills. Really the only thing going for this hotel is its location. I would strongly advise readers not to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: ProdigiousMG
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Thursday night at around 10pm local time to a beautifully presented hotel. Unfortunately, we were then told 'there's a problem with the room' with no further details provided. We were then sent off in a cab to another hotel trusting that it would be of equal or greater quality with the word 'upgrade' ringing in our ears. We were dropped off at possibly the worst hotel in Turkey and given a choice of 2 rooms. Unfortunately the choice was almost impossible as they were both as awful as each other. When we asked the concierge where we could go for a drink or a meal, he pointed up the street and said 'up that way but be careful, this is Turkey' (not at all the impression I got of the place in the few days we were there by the way). So not exactly the best way to start the holiday. However, we were transported back to the Pierre Loti after a fitful sleep and the hotel lived up to its reputation once they allowed us into our room. It has a great location, friendly staff, a rooftop bar with amazing views of the city and reasonably presented rooms. It was just a pity we got treated with such disdain on night 1 (in fairness, we were given a free meal as compensation but somehow that didn't seem enough).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel; very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Thornleigh Travel
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past 3 years and always found the staff to be helpful and consistantly good. The buffet breakfast is plentiful and served in a pleasant room on the top floor. The bedrooms, although not large, are comfortable and well maintained and furnished to a realistic standard for a superior tourist hotel. Its location is FIRST CLASS - very central for historical sights in Sultanahmet. Could not be more convenient. All-in-all, THE BEST CHOICE for a short stay to see Istanbul. David.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Poor Food”
Reviews.Author: alextowell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and had our first meal in Istanbul at the hotel as part of a â€˜valentineâ€™s showâ€™ which was to include a great meal and entertainment. Fortunately, we soon discovered that not all food in Istanbul resembled a half cooked Iceland special and this was limited only to this hotel. The buffet breakfast was very limited and you are charged more if you want to have anything cooked and edible. Real orange juice is also charged at an exorbitant rate. The view from the restaurant is good but not like it is portrayed in the hotel marketing and many other hotels have a better view. This aside, the hotel is located in an excellent position, it is clean and comfortable but rooms have no views and are rather small. Hotel staff are very helpful and the masseuse at the hotel is excellent and excellent value for money. However, the gym consists of one rowing machine, one treadmill in a space next to a desk downstairs at the beauty parlour where you can get the massage. In conclusion, this place is comfortable and clean and very well located but not for a long stay and probably not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved its location”
Reviews.Author: Rou12
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located on the PERFECT location, literally 10 minutes walk from Hagia Sofia & the Blue Mosque. Tramway is just outside the hotel. The room was average size, clean and the breakfast was very good. Do try the natural apple juice for Tur$5 . Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, helpful staff, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Hampshire-Pete
Reviews.Content: The hotel is stategically located for walking to the major sights of Istanbul. The tram stops close by, should you want to travel further, and the area has a safe feel to it. The hotel fronts onto a small square by a well lit main road. Plenty of bars and restaurants close by. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. A couple of minor issues with the room were efficiently and graciously rectified. The buffet breakfast I thought was good, though some reviewers seem to differ. I didn't feel the need to pay for any of the optional extras on offer, and I do enjoy a healthy appetite! The room was comfortable, clean, good facilities, pleasant view and quiet at night. It may have been a bit smaller than some would like, and if money is no obstacle undoubtedly you can find somewhere palatial. I thought I received excellent value for my money and would not hesitate in returning. My wife really enjoyed the hotel's on-site Turkish bath too.

Reviews.Title: “decent rooms, unbeatable location, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: khadijaox81
