Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at the pierre loti hotel in istanbul for 3 nights. upon arrival, we were pleasantly surprised to see that the hotel was very easy to find, right on sultahnamet's main road. the location is unbeatable: right in the heart of the historical centre, within very short walking distance of the city's main attractions. the lobby and reception are set in a beautiful decor, with period furnishings. check in was very swift and straightforward, we were shown to our rooms and taken to the top floor for a welcome drink. very pleasant, friendly atmosphere. rooms are a bit on the small side, but they still provide sufficient space for 2 people. the bathroom is quite large, there's no bath tub, but a big shower with glass panels, which is more than enough, really. breakfast is served on the 5th floor, in a large, airy room boasting nice views of the city. it consists of both a continental and turkish menu, which i found to be perfect as it caters for everyone's tastes: cereals, fruit juices, different types of bread, danish pastries, jams, but also cheeses, olives, eggs, sausages and potatoes, aubergines with feta cheese ( a delicious, typical turkish dish),etc...... there was plenty of choice, and as it was a buffet, we could have as much or as little as we liked. omelettes and freshly squeezed fruit juices are extra, but very good value for money. as for the staff, we found them very helpful and keen to do anything to make our stay pleasant and comfortable. i would specify that we went during a school holiday, and the hotel was fairly busy. i would definitely go back again, as it is excellent value for money for such a pleasant, well-located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great value”
Reviews.Author: Martinitraveller
Reviews.Content: It's a wonderful hotel in Istanbul, with a superb location, just within a 5-minutes walking distance of the most important square in Istanbul- Sultanahmet where you can see Hagia Sophia Museum, Sultanahmet Mosque and Topkapi Palace but also Metro Station, Taxis and A lot of restaurants just outside the door!! It has also a great rooftop terrasse from where you can see all Istanbul, from Europe to Asia, straight of Bosphorus, Marmara Sea. the Golden Horn and most of the major sights! It has a bar there and the breakfast room is just on the floor below offering also nice views. Staff was very welcoming and warm, speaking very good english. The only downside was some smell coming from the bathroom and the carpet rugs seem a little bit used in not very big rooms. But all in all is a great value close to the main atttractions! I will stay there again when I return to Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: f1mo
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the friendly staff and the location. The location is superb and makes the experience of Istanbul great. Most of the key sites are very close only a walking distance. Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, Sofia Hagia, Topkapi Palace, etc. They are all walking distance. If walking is not your thing, try the tram. It is fantastic, frequent and a great value. We caught the tram to take us all they way to the spice bazaar and continue to the other side to Galata Tower. The Staff at the hotel are great, helpful and would try their utmost to help. There is not a restaurant at the hotel itself although a cafe where breakfast is served, this is quite simple. There are local 'Western' familiarities like McDonalds and Starbucks. The rooms are quite basic and as the hotel is based directly in the centre there is some noise from emergency vehicles and trams. Whilst we were there the hotel was being worked on, so there were builders present. I would say the location is the best thing about this hotel and any short falls are quickly forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Pierre Loti great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Molly90
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very pleasant eight night stay in Pierre loti Hotel,Istanbul.It was a most pleasant experience from the minute we entered the hotel.The greeting was warm and friendly and the manager spent plenty time telling us about the facilities,places to see around Istanbul.The facilities were perfect,location very central and very adjacent to public transport.Every member of the hotel staff were helpful and friendly and made our stay a most pleasant experience.The only problem i encountered was a communication problem with leisure centre staff due to a language problem but this can be remidied very easily.I would definately use this hotel again and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: imty101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a nice and pleasant area of the Sultanahmet, just a few minutes walking distance from the main attractions such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Grand Bazaar. Taksim Square is about 10mins distance by car â€“ but my advice to anyone going there (or any other places of interest in the area for that matter) is to use the very efficient tram system (operating till 11.30pm) for a fraction of the price of using a taxi. There are no shortage of decent restaurants and shops, most of which are within a stones throw from the hotel and you will generally find yourself spoilt for choice. The hotel staff were polite, friendly and on the whole could speak a decent level of English. Free wifi was available to all guests (should they want to use it) and there was 1 computer located in the lobby with 24 hour free internet access. The hotel rooms were somewhat on the small side in my opinion but that didnâ€™t really bother us since they were clean and well presented with decent bathroom facilities. My only issue was that during our 7 night stay there, some renovation work was taking place to the terrace restaurant and so dining was temporarily located to the bar downstairs. Also, since our room was located on 4th floor, throughout the day at times, it tended to get quite noisy due to the works upstairs. This is the reason why I have marked down this hotel. Other than this (temporary) snag, i would happily recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “What you want to know”
Reviews.Author: EnglishMonkey2008
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Upon arrival we were offered a non-alcoholic cocktail in the lounge while our bags and room were being sorted out. Our room was on the small size but came equipped with the usuals. We were originally given a twin but asked if we could change to a double. This was done the following day, it did take a while but was all done with smiles. No major problems, the only one really was that the curtains didn't close properly, hardly a massive problem and all rooms are first floor and above. As for location, it's a short walk away from the main attractions and a short walk to the tram line which will take you most places. Overall it's a typical hotel with no hidden surprises

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ukkris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned yesterday 11th Nov, and I am afraid the Hotel was a great disapointment, firstly the heating was not working in our room, it took three requests to have it looked at before an engineer did arrive to tell us it was not working, after that it worked for about one hour and stopped again, it took another two requests for it to be looked at again, which did not happen instead the girl behind the counter told us it was because of the refurbishment, so we suggest that maybe they could provide a small heater, but nothing was forth coming, not even an update on the situation or maybe offering us a room with heating. The breakfast was served in the bar area which was very cramped, the choice for breakfast was very poor. The hotel was under refurbishment which meant the roof terrace was out of action (one of the reasons I booked this hotel was for the view) the lifts were covered in paper I suppose not to damage the walls as the workmen were using one of them to put debris in, and the outside was covered in scafolding. The only thing in favour of this hotel was it's excellent location. In my opinion this is definately not a 4 star hotel I would say it was more of a 3

Reviews.Title: “Excellently situated”
Reviews.Author: EmilyEngland
Reviews.Content: The Pierre Loti is in an excellent situation for the major tourist attractions in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. The rooms are definitely on the small size but are well furnished and the beds are comfortable. On request we were moved to a larger room. We found the staff helpful and polite. The breakfast was adequate and there are wonderful views of the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Hagai Sophia from the rooftop terrace which is to be made into a restaurant next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: david_kravitz
Reviews.Content: My travel agent was not keen to book this hotel but tried to push me to a bigger one. As a TripAdvisor fan, I had to force the issue by threatening to book online. My partner and I were picked up at the airport by a hotel courtesy bus at reasonable cost, and also returned to the airport the same way. Booking in was made simple by helpful staff, particularly the petite young lady on the desk but I am unfair; ALL the staff were helpful. Free drinks in the bar as we booked in whilst the luggage made its way to the room. Yes, the rooms are a little small, we are both tall, but there was everything there. Free coffee maker, a mini-bar, a free safe, easy chairs and plenty of hangers in the wardrobe, but no chest of drawers. Still, even for a week, there was plenty of space, even after shopping. There was a minor problem with the room but the hotel moved us whilst we ate our first breakfast. Breakfasts are on the top floor, but the lifts stop one floor below so disabled guests might not be able to reach it. The food was adequate, but simple. Three containers of hot dishes, a large range of cereals, cheeses, vegetables and bread (the white was very moreish), a few cakes, some sort of fruit juices in a dispenser, tea and coffee and be quick if you want a mini-croissant. Breakfast 7.30-10.30am. Freshly squeezed fruit juices and omlets are extra, we had delicious orange juice at 5 lira each, (we called lira yettels). The Turks don't seem to eat a lot a fruit, its even difficult to buy, locally. We did not use the bar or the health spa downstairs so I cannot comment, but I did use the free Internet. As others have said, there are two i's, use the one with a dot over it, and the @ is a little tricky too, but the young man on reception is helpful here. If hotels are all about location, this hotel wins, hands-down, against the big boys such as the Hilton, Ritz Plaza and the Marmara. You are very close to all the main historic sites, the mosques and churches, Topkapi museum and the incredible cisterns and much more. The mostly crowded trams run past the hotel and 1.4 yettels will get you down to the sea front and the Spice bazaar (a must) and the Bosphorus water tours. There is also a small mall of famous name shops by the waterfront. A short walk in the opposite direction from the hotel will get you to a bus terminal where the 94 (?) will take you to its other terminus and the twin shopping centres of Capacity and Carousel (the former with high quality shops plus Marks and Spencer clothing). That same walk (to the left) will also lead you to the Grand Bazaar which is huge. (There is a small bazaar to the left of the Blue Mosque as well). There is a lot of shopping in this area around the hotel but not always high quality, but DO barter. Put your own price/value on something and stick to your guns, you may win. Fake LaCoste shirts in this area are double what you pay in the underpasses around the Spice Bazaar. Eating around the hotel is good, even for us non-meat eaters. The hotel will get you a free mini-bus to and from a very good restaurant near the waterside although it was the most expensive place we ate in, at 140 yettles for the two of us. Around the hotel we usually paid under 100. We used the Central (to the right and across the road) three times and the Sultanahmet fish restaurant up the road past the cistern, twice. Both highly recommended. As you walk everywhere you are accosted by restaurants and shops enticing you into their premises. Exchange good humour with them and be as polite as they are to fully enjoy the experience. Being Israeli, we wanted to visit the Neve Hashalom synagogue. This is quite tricky and needs to be pre-booked. The hotel staff were great in organising this. They also pre-booked a open-topped (weather permitting) Grayline tour bus that takes you on a 90-minute tour of this vast city. Worth every yettle. This was the end of October and the weather was mixed, from glorious to diabolical on one day, so take an umbrella and some warm clothes. And don't forget your camera. We first visited Turkey on a cruise in June 2008 and instantly fell in love with the country and its people. Its racial tolerence should serve as a benchmark. If you expecting the Ritz Carlton, go stay there. If you are looking for great value for money in a fantastic location, go stay at the Pierre Loti.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Avidkeentraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Pierre Loti hotel end of october 2008. About the location: It is located in the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul which is the historical district. Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia are at a stone's throw. Basilca Cistern and Grand Bazaar are within a mile. There are lots of really nice cafes nd restaurants surrounding the hotel and for those of us who like familiar territories, Starbucks is across the road and McDonalds about a 100 yards away. Also, there are lots of local shops where you can buy local treats and souveniers. The whole place has a nice lively feel about it. A cab from Ata Turk airport should cost no more than Â£15 or 38 YLT (turkish lira). It is better to get money changed in Turkey rather than at a UK airport - rates are better in Turkey and money changers are all over the place. About the hotel: This is small hotel with about 15 - 20 rooms. The room was comfortable but space was limited. There were tea coffee facilities, a basic minibar, and a safe provided in the room. The bathroom was reasonably nice with good pressure in the shower! You get nice fresh towels and a bathrobe. The hairdryer provided left my hair really frizzy so take your own. The socket connection is two round holes similar to those in France. The staff were friendly and helpful and had good knowledge of the area. There is free wireless internet in the lobby and in the room. There is also a computer with internet facilities in the lobby and refreshingly, it is free to use. The turkish keyboard has two "i"s so its a bit difficult to use. Breakfast is a bit disappointing. Its served on the top floor and you have to pay extra for an omlette, eggs or freshly squeezed juice. Cold stuff is free but limited in choice. I didnt fancy rice krispies for breakfast and there was limited choice of healthy cereals. We ended up not going to breakfast altogether as there are loads of nice cafes outside that serve hot breakfast at a very reasonable price. The hotel has a traditional turkish bath. For a 2 and half hour session including exfoliation and massage, it cost 50 Euros. Definately worth the money. Very good experience and it leaves the skin baby soft. There are other traditional turkis baths in the area but are not as clean and modern as the one at Pierre Loti. I would definately recommend this hotel. About the weather: I arrived in Istanbul on the 18th of October and the weather was pleasant. You need a light jacket during the day and something a bit heavier at night. We were able to dine alfresco almost everywhere though. It can rain in istanbul in october and a mac/umbrella would be a wise option. If you are blonde - better to dye your hair a darker colour as it can attract alot attention - sometimes pleasant but sometimes it can be a bit much. Guys in Istanbul are friendly (and cocky) so you get approached on the street alot. I enjoyed the friendliness and it was all good fun! A cruise on the Bosphorous is definately recommended. On one side you see the asian coast and on the other the eurpoean coast. You pass under the bridge that connects the two continents. A 90 minute cruise cost us Â£2 each!!!! You get it from Emininou and a cab ride from Pierre Loti in Sultanahmet to Eminiou costs about 12 YTL or Â£5. If you are considering going to Istanbul - dont hesitate as you are bound to enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “watch out”
Reviews.Author: mohayat2000
Reviews.Content: After having travelled for the last 7 or more hours we were expected to relax in the hotel for a few hours but this luxury was denied for another 1 hour or so, due to the fact that the room we booked was out of order reason given was electricity travelling to the taps so this posed a health hazzard ??. However my suspicions were that the room was double booked however as a compensation package we were treated to 2 free orange juices for breakfast we should have been greatful but were not impressed, there were other incentives 10% of mini bar and free sauna/hammam which we didnt have the pleasure of taking of advantage of. The hotel we were transfered to for the 1st night was not in such a good location, and much further away than we had anticipated also the quality of the hotel not as good, we did try to complain b4 we left but no real notice was taken. For people booking this hotel and experiencing a simaler situation i would reccomend you insist on seeing the room with the problem just to make sure there is a room with a problem and not someone else sleeping in your room

Reviews.Title: “I am so glad we stayed there!”
Reviews.Author: Rebec-PDX
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location---just a short walk to the hagia sofia abd blue mosque. It is near the tram line and many places to eat. The hotel was very clean and the staff were tremendously helpful. They all spoke english to some degree, and were readily available to answer any questions we had. The breakfast had great variety, and it was a typical european breakfast. Yes, you could pay extra and get an omlette or fresh squeezed juice, but the regular juice is just as good. The hotel was also decorated nicely inside. My only complaint is that the room was a little small, but that is compared to American hotel rooms. Compared to European hotel rooms, they were the normal size. Overall, I was very pleased with this hotel and if I go back to Istanbul, I definitely will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: veniceJ
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at this hotel for one week. They gave us a great corner room on a high floor (as requested)..the location could not have been better for walking to almost all the sights one wants to see. It was also very close to the tram stop. Although they tried to be helpful every time I felt that their English could have been a bit better for dealing with tourists...also they need to get up to par for giving directions to many of the sights or even common places one would want to go instead of always saying take a taxi...I think they could learn more about public transportation to be able to help those who prefer to take it......They did go over and beyond the call to duty when one of the staff accompanied me to the bank to act as a translator...I would go back to this hotel and would have no problem recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyTraveller_8
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time in Istanbul! This hotel is excellent in many ways. The location is outstanding as it is only a few minutes walk from ALL of the major attractions. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well equipped and maintained. The hotel provided us with corner rooms on request without any difficulty at all. All of the staff in the hotel are very helpful and friendly. The staff at reception were particularly good with travel advice and directions. The only disappointment was the Russian woman in the hotel's health club. She was surly, aggressive and unhelpful. So if you want to experience a Turkish Bath, just walk down the street to the historical Cemeralitas baths instead! Oterwise, I would have no hesitation in recommeding or returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - unless you're a taxi!”
Reviews.Author: LondonCes
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights in Istanbul following my football (soccer) team. The result of the match may have been a disappointment, but the hotel certainly was not! From the start, check in was relaxed and welcoming with a complimentary drink while they sorted out the formalities. Room was on the small side, but adequate and clean (although a bit more storage would have been useful). Some noise at night from trams, restaurant downstairs and people in the street, but if you are bothered about this you could always ask for a room that doesn't overlook the main street. Breakfast was nothing special, although great views of the skyline (including Blue Mosque), but freshly squeezed fruit juice and omlettes are available for a small premium. Extremely convenient location for the main attractions in the Old City and beyond; walking distance of Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagya Sofya etc. and very close to the tram stop that will take you further afield. However, it is a nightmare for taxi drivers; the hotel is on the corner of a dead end street and traffic is barred from the main road (trams only). Before my visit I was slightly concerned about being a lone female visitor to Istanbul, but the service and general helpfulness of staff soon quelled any concerns. There are of course many 'boutique' hotels in Sultanahmet area and although some are in a much prettier location I would still recommend the Pierre Loti for its convenience to everything and warm hospitality.
